API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.core.scenegraph.Node

type
class
subclasses
sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable, sandy.core.scenegraph.Group, sandy.core.scenegraph.TagCollection, sandy.core.scenegraph.mode7.Mode7
version
3.1
ABSTRACT CLASS - Base class for all nodes in the object tree.

The base class for all Group and object nodes, that handles all basic operations on a tree node.

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_sName A string identifier for this object.
Creates a node in the object tree of the world.

This constructor should normally not be called directly, only from a sub class.

Instance Variables

__getChanged(default,method) : Void -> Bool

__getScene(default,method) : Void -> sandy.core.Scene3D

__setChanged(default,method) : pVal : Bool -> Bool

addChild(default,method) : p_oChild : Node -> Void

Adds a new child to this node.

A node can have several children, and when you add a child to a node, it is automatically connected to the parent node through its parent property.

addEventListener(default,method) : p_sEvt : String -> p_oL : (T -> Void) -> Void

Adds a listener for the specified event.

appearance(__getAppearance,__setAppearance) : sandy.materials.Appearance

Set that appearance to all the children of that node

boundingBox : sandy.bounds.BBox

The bounding box of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

boundingSphere : sandy.bounds.BSphere

The bounding sphere of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

broadcaster(__getBroadcaster,__setBroadcaster) : sandy.events.BubbleEventBroadcaster

The broadcaster

The broadcaster is used to send events to listeners.
This property is a BubbleEventBroadcaster.

changed(__getChanged,__setChanged) : Bool

This property set the cache status of the current node. IMPORTANT Currently this property IS IN USE FOR CACHE SYSTEM

children : Array<Node>

The children of this node are stored inside this array. IMPORTANT: Use this property mainly as READ ONLY. To add, delete or search a specific child, you can use the specific method to do that

cull(default,method) : p_oFrustum : sandy.view.Frustum -> p_oViewMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4 -> p_bChanged : Bool -> Void

Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

If the node and its children aren't in the frustum, the node is set to cull and will not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes, to make a more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform a more precise culling.

MANDATORY The update method must be called first!

culled : Int

This property represent the culling state of the current node. This state is defined during the culling phasis as it refers to the position of the object against the viewing frustum.

destroy(default,method) : Void -> Void

Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

enableBackFaceCulling(__getEnableBackFaceCulling,__setEnableBackFaceCulling) : Bool

Specifies whether back face culling be enabled for this object. If set to false all faces of this object are drawn. A true value enables the back face culling algorithm - Default true

enableEvents(__getEnableEvents,__setEnableEvents) : Bool

Enables the event system for mouse events.

When set to true, the onPress, onRollOver and onRollOut events are broadcast.
The event system is enabled or disabled for all faces of this object.
As an alternative, you have the possibility to enable events only for specific faces.

Once this feature is enabled, the animation is more CPU intensive.

Example var l_oShape:Shape3D = new Sphere("sphere"); l_oShape.enableEvents = true; l_oShape.addEventListener( MouseEvent.CLICK, onClick ); function onClick( p_eEvent:Shape3DEvent ):void { var l_oPoly:Polygon = ( p_eEvent.polygon ); var l_oPointAtClick:Point3D = p_eEvent.point; // -- get the normalized uv of the point under mouse position var l_oIntersectionUV:UVCoord = p_eEvent.uv; // -- get the correct material var l_oMaterial:BitmapMaterial = (l_oPoly.visible ? l_oPoly.appearance.frontMaterial : l_oPoly.appearance.backMaterial) as BitmapMaterial; }

enableInteractivity(__getEnableInteractivity,__setEnableInteractivity) : Bool

Enable the interactivity on this shape and its polygon. Be careful, this mode have some requirements : - to have useSingleContainer set to false. It is done automatically if enabled The original settings are back to their original state when the mode is disabled

getChildByName(default,method) : p_sName : String -> ?p_bRecurs : Bool -> Node

Returns the child node with the specified name.

hasParent(default,method) : Void -> Bool

Tests if this node has a parent.

id : Int

The unique id of this node in the node graph.

This value is very useful to retrieve a specific node.

isParent(default,method) : p_oNode : Node -> Bool

Tests if the node passed in the argument is parent of this node.

modelMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4

Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the 0,0,0 frame system

name : String

Name of this node. Of no name is specified, the unique ID of the node will be used

parent(__getParent,__setParent) : Node

The parent node of this node.

The reference is null if this node has no parent (for exemple for a root node).

perform(default,method) : p_iOperation : INodeOperation -> Void

Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

Traverses the subtree made up of this node and all of its children. While traversing the subtree, individual operations are performed on entry and exit of each node of the subtree.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.

remove(default,method) : Void -> Void

Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

NOTE that remove method only remove the current node and NOT its children!
To remove the current node and all its children please refer to the destroy method.

The child nodes of this node becomes child nodes of this node's parent.

removeChild(default,method) : p_oNode : Node -> Node

Removes the specified child. All children of the node you want to remove are lost. The link between them and the rest of the tree is broken, so they will not be rendered anymore. The object itself and its children are still in memory, if you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()

removeChildByName(default,method) : p_sName : String -> Node

Removes the child node with the specified name. All children of the node you want to remove are lost. The link between them and the rest of the tree is broken, so they will not be rendered anymore. The object itself and its children are still in memory, if you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()

removeEventListener(default,method) : p_sEvt : String -> p_oL : (T -> Void) -> Void

Removes a listener for the specified event.

scene(__getScene,__setScene) : sandy.core.Scene3D

Reference to the scene is it linked to. Initially null.

swapParent(default,method) : p_oNewParent : Node -> Void

Moves this node to another parent node.

This node is removed from its current parent node, and added as a child of the specified node

toString(default,method) : Void -> String

Returns a string representation of this object

update(default,method) : p_oModelMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4 -> p_bChanged : Bool -> Void

Updates this node.

For a node with transformation, this method update the transformation taking into account the matrix cache system.

updateBoundingVolumes(default,method) : Void -> Void

Updates the bounding volumes of this object. NO IMPLEMENTATION RIGHT NOW. MIGHT BE USED IN THE FUTURE

useSingleContainer(__getUseSingleContainer,__setUseSingleContainer) : Bool

Property that changes the way to render this object, Set to true, the shape will be rendered into a single Sprite object, which is accessible through the container property. Set to false, the container property does not target anything, but all the polygons will be rendered into their own dedicated container.

If true, this object renders itself on a single container ( Sprite ),
if false, each polygon is rendered on its own container.

viewMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4

Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the camera frame system

visible(__getVisible,__setVisible) : Bool

Specify the visibility of this node. If true, the node is visible, if fase, it will not be displayed.
